title: Prelude to Programming: Concepts and Design 6th c2015 Venit
description:
Prelude to Programming: Concepts and Design, 6th Global Edition (c2015), textbook by Stewart Venit & Elizabeth Drake.

TEXTBOOK INFO:
Int'l: <a href=" http://www.pearsoned.co.nz/9781292061535" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsoned.co.nz/9781292061535</a>
Nat'l: <a href=" http://www.pearsonhighered.com/pearsonhigheredus/educator/product/products_detail.page?isbn=013374163X" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsonhighered.com/pearsonhigheredus/educator/product/products_detail.page?isbn=013374163X</a>

NOTE: The 6th international (global) and national editions differ only by the
      cover, the copyright page and the way pages are numbered.

COURSES: Pre-Programming and Introductory Programming courses at college and
         university levels.

FEATURES:
--------
Provides a language-independent introduction to programming concepts that helps students learn the following:
 * General programming topics, such as data types, control structures, arrays,
   files, functions, and subprograms.
 * Structured programming principles, such as modular design, proper program
   documentation and style, and event-driven and object-oriented program design.
 * Basic tools and algorithms, such as data validation, defensive programming,
   sums and averages computation, and searching and sorting algorithms.
 * Real programming experience through the optional use of RAPTOR, a free
   flowchart-based programming environment (aka algorithm visualization).
 * Data representation of integer and floating point numbers.
 * (Pseudocode vs. flowchart)

No prior computer or programming experience is necessary (preferable?).

The flowchart interpreter RAPTOR is available at <a href=" http://raptor.martincarlisle.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://raptor.martincarlisle.com/</a>

BRIEF CONTENTS:
--------------
0. Introduction
1. An Introduction to Programming
2. Data Representation
3. Developing a Program
4. Selection Structures: Making Decisions
5. Repetition Structures: Looping
6. More about Loops and Decisions
7. Arrays: Lists and Tables
8. Searching and Sorting Arrays
9. Program Modules, Subprograms, and Functions
10. Sequential Data Files
11. Object-Oriented and Event-Driven Programming
APPENDICES:
 A: Study Skills
 B: The ASCII Character Set: Printable Characters
 C: Answers to Self Checks
Errata
(detailed contents at national website above)

FILE INFO: Paginated, bookmarked, true PDF. Answers & some RAP files included.
           Textbook, answers and RAP files are foldered.
           Compressed (zipped): *right-click* the filename (.7z) & choose *Extract*
           to convert to PDF; discard the .7z file (container) when done with
           seeding
